Name: Echoing Marche
QuestDesc: As the tides of danger retreat, Jinzhou appears tranquil and vibrant. But beyond its borders lies a fierce and desperate battleground.

Unlock.Name: The Past is the Future: Introduction

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mrs. Panhua, g'morning! Three bowls of extra spicy noodles, please!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What did I tell ya? Nothing beats a bowl of spicy noodles in the morning!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you say, Rover?

Options.PlotLineKey: I haven't had my first bite yet.
I love it. It's just the way I like!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like Baizhi's locked herself in the lab again, hasn't left since yesterday. Bet we won't see her til she's done with her research.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, wait. Since you're the subject of that research, we could use you as bait to lure her out. We can tie you up at the Academy's entrance...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And with just a few tugs of the rope, I bet every researcher will come running at you, with Baizhi leading the pack. Hook, line, and sinker!

Options.PlotLineKey: We could give it a try.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In case of an emergency! Rover, roll out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oops. I got carried away. My bad!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way. Now that we've figured out the sugar pearl and the sundial, all that's left is that weird leaf and run-of-the-mill mangosteen, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So it only took us one trip to the Academy to solve half of our problems. Either Rover's really smart, or Madam Magistrate was gonna make it easy for us to begin with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's our next plan of action, Rover?

Options.PlotLineKey: Look into the strange leaf first.
We've got two more days. Might as well just wait.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the mangosteen, we've got people selling these at the market nearby. Might find some clues there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mangosteens are not from Jinzhou. These fruits are usually brought in by boat. Should we start from the harbor?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you think the token is guiding us outside the city?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Baizhi said the leaf bears the frequencies of Tacet Discords, so it must be from a tree near a Tacet Field.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then we must leave the city to pursue this lead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, that may work too. Any plans for the next two days, Rover?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Tell them about the dream you had.)
Madam Magistrate gave me the Access Pass for that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An ocean of stars... A dark-haired girl... An inverted Etheric Sea... And the Resonance Cord flowing from your Tacet Mark...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you said it was flowing in a certain direction. The nearest places are the Gorges of Spirits and the Norfall Barrens...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've never mentioned this before.

Options.PlotLineKey: I couldn't find the right moment.
I thought it was just a dream.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Etheric Sea and Resonance Cords in your dreams are real, possibly leading to the Gorges of Spirits and Norfall Barrens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps... It was more than just a dream.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That girl might be the key to recovering your memories. Madam Magistrate's information aside, it seems to me your dream points toward the Norfall Barrens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the site of the Threnodian War and the source of all TD Outbreaks. The Midnight Rangers' frontlines base is stationed there as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Access Pass may be another hint...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are usually no checkpoints set up in the city besides the City Hall. A pass isn't required unless you have to leave the city borders.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now why didn't I think of that? Gotta hand it to ya, Yangyang!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the spirit! Been beating my brain up until now, it's time to get these joints cracking for a change!

Options.PlotLineKey: I don't know who I am.
I don't know why I'm here.
All I know is I must kill!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoooah! {Male=He;Female=She}'s fast! {Male=He;Female=She}'s furious! {Male=He;Female=She}'s a TD killing machine!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Please stop it, you two.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a no-go for me if you're leaving the city, my shift's coming up. Protect Rover well and shoot me a message if you need anything, alright Yangyang?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm sure you meant the other way around.
You can just wait for the good news.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe in ya!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Without a doubt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You, Chixia, and Yangyang gather at Panhua's restaurant, where you continue the discussion about the tokens. The group reasons that clues may lie outside the city limits, so you and Yangyang decide to go and take a look.

Chapters.Title: Get ready to leave the city
Get ready to leave the city

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We Resonators can boost our combat abilities with special items. Our Echoes can use them too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you feel like it, head to Instructor Yhan at the training camp for extra practice and to get these enhancement items.

Chapters.Title: Get ready to leave the city

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yangyang, did you hear that? I-Is that someone crying and wailing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That should be the Midnight Rangers training camp... Let's not worry about it, Chixia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Instructor Yhan is in charge of training new recruits. I heard he's pretty tough, but I think Rover can handle anything he throws at {Male=him;Female=her}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Defense at the city gate has been strengthened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It wasn't like this when we came back...

Dialogues.Speaker: Guarding Soldier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Access Pass is required if you're heading to the Norfall Barrens. That place is now off-limits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shifting Soldier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is your business, young lady? It's my third shift and you're still here.
Oh, you must be the soldier on duty at noon yesterday. Nice to see you again.
I'm a Resonator and a trained martial artist. I can handle myself. Please, I need to go look for someone.
I've promised the missing man's grandfather to bring him back. Would you let me through?

Dialogues.Speaker: Guarding Soldier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Be that as it may, I cannot let you given the current circumstances. My apologies.
Well, everything seems fine in the city. Are things really that bad on the frontlines?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shifting Soldier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why we must stay vigilant, so people in the city can go on peacefully with their lives.

Dialogues.Speaker: Guarding Soldier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, General Jiyan is currently there at the Norfall Barrens base. Dangerous as it is, he will keep an eye on every soldier, including the one you're looking for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shifting Soldier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have already sent a report on your case. You could just go home and wait for the good news. What's the point of staying here?
Thank you, but I have already asked the Patrol Station for help and tried every method I could think of. Please, let me through. I promised him, so I gotta give it my all.
I understand your concern.

I don't want to be a bother. Would it help if I hid my presence and stayed somewhere further away? How about five miles? Or maybe a hundred? A thousand might be too far though, I wouldn't be able to see you clearly...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shifting Soldier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Listen. Nobody knows when the soldiers will return, and even if they do, you might not find the one you seek.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shifting Soldier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a dangerous road ahead if you want to reach the frontlines, and you don't even have an Access Pass...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shifting Soldier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Ahem. Your Access Pass has been verified.

Dialogues.Speaker: Guarding Soldier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just you two?

Options.PlotLineKey: The monk over there is coming with us.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings. I'm Jianxin. Could you please do me a favor?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to go look for someone outside the city, but I don't have an Access Pass, so... May I tag along?

Options.PlotLineKey: What can you do for us?
What do I get out of this?
You'll have to ask the guards about that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for your kindness!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm a jack-of-all-trades: Tai Chi, cooking, tea-making, mining, foraging, errand-running, fixing utilities, and caring for animals. Got something else in mind? I'm always up for learning new skills.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. I've got three Guokui Flatbreads, 34 Shell Credits, and the Mirrors of Clarity. They're all yours.

Options.PlotLineKey: You seem to live a humble life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right. I should be open about my request. I don't want to lie and cause further trouble for the soldiers.
Thank you for your help! I really appreciate it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I intend to leave the city with them, and they have agreed. Will it be an issue for you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shifting Soldier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I, uh...

Dialogues.Speaker: Guarding Soldier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, it says you have the highest level of access, so no procedural issues here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shifting Soldier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Honestly, {Male=he;Female=she} could lead an entire troop out of the city with that Access Pass and no one would question it...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At the city gate, you encounter Jianxin, a Taoist who is being denied passage. After learning she is searching for a missing person, you use your authority to help her leave the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jianxin explains why she wants to leave the city. She tells you about the person she is looking for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you're looking for the relative of a veteran, and you believe he's in the Midnight Rangers camp in Desorock Highland?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly.

Options.PlotLineKey: What's your relationship with the person you're looking for?
Why is it so important for you to find him?
Do you know anything about the mangosteen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His name is Zhiyuan. I don't know him in person. On my way down the mountain, I ran into his grandfather, who was looking for his grandson on his own but ended up lost.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I couldn't just leave an elderly person like him out there. So I thought I'd escort him to the nearest city and make further plans once we're safe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're willing to go to such lengths for someone you don't know...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have a kind soul, Master Jianxin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's all thanks to many kind-hearted people. Without them, Mr. Zongye and I wouldn't have made it to Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Zongye seemed confused. He's gone through a lot searching for his enlisted grandson. Lending a helping hand was the least I could do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I reported his situation to the Patrol Station, but with the chaos on the frontline, Mr. Zongye has been extremely worried about his grandson's safety... He'd sneak out to look for his grandson the moment no one was watching. I'm really worried about him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This mangosteen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's got some fresh-looking leaves, soft springy skin, and eight fleshy segments fully ripened inside. It looks like a nice fruit.

Options.PlotLineKey: Well... thanks for the tip on how to pick out the good ones.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, one more thing I forgot to mention. There's a bruise at the bottom. If you don't eat that part soon, it'll spoil.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I grew up in my sect on a mountain. Spent most of my time training with my masters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, I was told training in seclusion was not enough. I must engage with the world to further my skills.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I started my self-cultivating journey. I've been to various cities and gained valuable lessons, but there is still so much more to learn.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...According to what I've gathered, Mr. Zongye's grandson is very likely in the Desorock Highland.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to your help, I can finally leave the city to find him.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's where we are heading too.
Master Jianxin, please keep us safe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jianxin explains she is searching for a boy named Zhiyuan. He vanished after leaving the city, and his grandfather tasked her to find him. Sadly, she has no information about the tokens you are investigating.

Dialogues.Speaker: Passing Midnight Ranger
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't look like soldiers. Why are you here? The frontlines are right up ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am Yangyang, an Outrider of the Midnight Rangers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yangyang showed her Midnight Rangers badge and Jianxin asked him about Zhiyuan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Passing Midnight Ranger
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A missing person... Zhiyuan...

Dialogues.Speaker: Passing Midnight Ranger
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The one you're looking for. Is he an average person? Not a Resonator, I suppose?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, have you seen him? Is he alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: Passing Midnight Ranger
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I met him once. He's not officially enlisted, but he seemed determined to join us. He's been secretly following our troops since last year.

Dialogues.Speaker: Passing Midnight Ranger
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think a quartermaster of the Rearguards escorted him away, so if he's not in the city...

Dialogues.Speaker: Passing Midnight Ranger
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He must be in the Rearguards camp. He can't be anywhere else; the actual frontlines are right up ahead, and we the Midnight Rangers would never allow non-servicemen to approach and risk getting killed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Passing Midnight Ranger
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now if you're heading that way, I have a request for you, my Outrider comrade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Passing Midnight Ranger
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On your way there, you should run into two Detection Beacons. They just went offline. Could you go check on them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure, we will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Passing Midnight Ranger
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great. I'll send the coordinates to your Terminal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Midnight Ranger reveals details about Zhiyuan's disappearance, and you agree to check on the Detection Beacons that have been disconnected.

Chapters.Title: Use the Sensor to reveal the patrol route
Follow the patrol route to find the Detection Beacon

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that the Beacon? Why are there so many people?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They don't look like soldiers...

Chapters.Title: Follow the patrol route to find the Detection Beacon

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings. What might interest you here? It's dangerous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh. We, uh... Nothing, really. You see, we're just on our way south, to the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excuse me, about this Detection Beacon...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Run, everyone!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you near the first Detection Beacon, you stumble upon some shifty-looking "civilians." You move to confront them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I can't move... So hungry...

Dialogues.Speaker: Flustered Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: P-please don't arrest us! We really had no choice!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened? Do you need help?

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The battles are getting real bad up north, and we couldn't live there anymore. Figured we have to go back to the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We ain't eaten in ages, and we're broke. Some of us can barely move 'cause we're so damn hungry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then we found some expensive looking stuff here. Now that the military's out there fighting and nobody's really using these thingies, we thought it might get us a few pennies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A damaged Detection Beacon might result in a sudden TD invasion from the direction it covers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our frontline troops would face attacks from both sides. Have you thought about the consequences?

Dialogues.Speaker: Flustered Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We ain't got the time for that! If we don't steal, we'd starve to death before the Tacet Discords kill us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You shouldn't be stealing public property. Please return the parts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's still some distance from here to Jinzhou city. Here, you can have my flatbreads.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And here's some money. This should be enough for you to reach the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're giving us... all of these? Thank you. Thank you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Flustered Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey! You! Come over and say thank you before you eat!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was nothing. Master once told me, "The sage takes care of all men, and abandons none."

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You offer assistance to the "civilians" responsible for damaging the Detection Beacon, but they repay your kindness with violence. You have no choice but to teach them a lesson.

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I can't move... So hungry...

Dialogues.Speaker: Flustered Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: P-please don't arrest us! We really had no choice!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened? Do you need help?

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The battles are getting real bad up north, and we couldn't live there anymore. Figured we have to go back to the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We ain't eaten in ages, and we're broke. Some of us can barely move 'cause we're so damn hungry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then we found some expensive looking stuff here. Now that the military's out there fighting and nobody's really using these thingies, we thought it might get us a few pennies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A damaged Detection Beacon might result in a sudden TD invasion from the direction it covers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our frontline troops would face attacks from both sides. Have you thought about the consequences?

Dialogues.Speaker: Flustered Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We ain't got the time for that! If we don't steal, we'd starve to death before the Tacet Discords kill us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You shouldn't be stealing public property. Please return the parts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's still some distance from here to Jinzhou city. Here, you can have my flatbreads.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And here's some money. This should be enough for you to reach the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're giving us... all of these? Thank you. Thank you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Flustered Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey! You! Come over and say thank you before you eat!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was nothing. Master once told me, "The sage takes care of all men, and abandons none."

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You offer assistance to the "civilians" responsible for damaging the Detection Beacon, but they repay your kindness with violence. You have no choice but to teach them a lesson.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph, a tough nut, aren't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just helped you. Why did you attack us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're not feedin' all of us with ya bread and pennies.  Hand over your goods and grub or face the consequences.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We ain't messin' with no kids, but don't test our patience. Just do as you're told!

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't make it tough on yourselves. Or you'll be lucky to leave in one piece.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will not bend to injustice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, Yangyang, please step back as I handle them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fine! You asked for this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Flustered Civilian?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're beggin' ya, stop! We surrender. Take us in!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why did you attack us when I already gave you food and funds?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you have other mouths to feed, aside from what we see here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They seem trained... These are not ordinary people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O-of course we are ordinary people! We just... we just joined the Exiles recently.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We done some wrongs. Tried to run from them Patrollers and left the city, but dang, didn't know the battles up north were so crazy. Our new boss ran outta food before we could even figure out the camp. Figured we'd be better off just go back to the city and get locked up...

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then we ran outta food and cash halfway. So we turned to thieving.

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We ain't got the balls to rob the army, but with stuff just sitting around, why not?

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, since you're being so generous, how about you throw a little extra cash our way? There's a bunch of us, some injured too. Your first amount ain't gonna cut it for us to survive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait. What I gave them was more than enough for them to make it to Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait. What I gave them was enough for them to make it to Jinzhou, even when they are so many.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I used to travel alone when I left my Master. I know how much it takes for someone to survive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey! What's wrong with you, girlie? It won't hurt to give us more!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pain comes with coveting. He who knows he has enough is rich. It was only meant to sustain you long enough for you to reach the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't understand, girl. You don't make money very easily in a time like this. If we can't find jobs in the city, we gonna starve again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I came from a seclusive place, learning the ways of the world from scratch. It's been a hard time, but even I have managed to make a living with my own hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you really can't find any job in the city, come to Liuxian Teahouse and ask for Jianxin. I'll gladly help you search for jobs and work alongside you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tsk... Fine! Fine! We'll go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hurry, move! Let's get outta here. I'm not listening to this lecture anymore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wasn't trying to... Wait, please put that down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, quite the sharp eye you got. Fine! Here you go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this the only Detection Beacon you messed with?

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heck yeah! Just the first one we were trying to steal and you bumped right into it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? Then why does that one over there seem broken too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That ain't got nothing to do with us! It has been that way for ages. Plus, we ain't ever reaching it with all those thorns.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. You may leave now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The military's base is not far from here. Shall we fix the Beacons before going?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Upon subduing the Exiles masquerading as civilians, you reclaim the stolen components and head for the next Detection Beacon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it... fixed?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Let's go and check on the next one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Awesome, we've got the second Beacon fixed.

Chapters.Title: Use Levitator to burn off the thorns with Explosive Charge

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The thorns are blocking our path. Weird. We'll have to clear them before we can reach the Beacon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please be careful, they look sharp. Maybe we can find something nearby to help us deal with them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Master Jianxin, are you alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is my first time on a battlefield. It feels so different here...

Chapters.Title: Ask the staff about the current situation

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know another shipment of supplies has just arrived. I've confirmed it, but it's not nearly enough. We must reach out to the city again and demand more supplies immediately.

Dialogues.Speaker: Logistics Specialist
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the approval process is going to...

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tell them it's an emergency. We are working around the clock here. Any delay could mean the end of our defense. Do they not comprehend? Here's the list of what we need.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll talk to them if you can't make them listen! Now go go go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Move, move! What is it? Why are we still not done distributing these?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You new here? Are you backups too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, you don't look like one of us...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am Yangyang, an Outrider of the Midnight Rangers. And they are...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yangyang showed her Midnight Rangers badge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excuse me. One moment, please.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Careful! This chest holds vital medical supplies. If the wounded return and find no medicine, it's on you. Handle with care and precision!

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An Outrider? So you are part of the backup force, right? Now, I've got wounded soldiers coming soon, and you're just in time to help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry. Have to answer this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. What is it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An Overclocked Resonator? Understood. I'll be there immediately.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry... Erm, could you do me a favor?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The wounded soldiers are being sent back from the frontlines. We need someone to escort them to the medics, but I've got to deal with the Overclocked Resonator now. Could you please take care of them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What exactly do you need us to do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just make sure they are safe. The medics will take care of their wounds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xiulan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's so busy here... Looks like they don't even have the time to catch their breath.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Supplies, medical care, equipment maintenance, personnel management, and logistics... They must carefully manage these matters to provide vital support for our fighters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So this is what a real war looks like. I had no idea it could get this bad.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most people would never have the chance to witness any of this. It's natural for you not to know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think this is exactly what our military strives forto ensure peace and safety for our citizens. It's a sacrifice made so others don't have to live in fear.

Options.PlotLineKey: The wounded soldiers are here. Let's go check on them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Upon arriving at the Rearguard Camp, you are greeted by a scene of chaos, revealing the grim state of the ongoing conflict. There, you meet logistic coordinator Xiulan and agree to help tend to the wounded.

Chapters.Title: Look after the insisting wounded soldier

Dialogues.Speaker: Suihe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like I said, it's not a big deal! No need to fix me up! Let me go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please calm down. Your wound is still bleeding.

Dialogues.Speaker: Suihe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's barely a scratch! You can't stop me!

Options.PlotLineKey: Now is not the time for bravado.

Dialogues.Speaker: Suihe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's not bravado! My wounds can close on their own. It's my Resonance ability. The medics should go take care of other people in need!

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stop squirming, will you? We're here because you need our help. Calm down and stay where you are!

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please hold him still for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After some chaos, you helped medics in treating the wounded.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A severely wounded soldier begs to return to battle, insisting that resources should be reserved for those in greater need. You treat him, despite his loud protests.

Chapters.Title: Look after the weak wounded soldier

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hah... hah...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm okay... just... a little... out of breath...

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay... I'm fine...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll go find a medic.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You brought the medic over to take care of Xinyu.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A wounded soldier is in distress. You summon a medic to his side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for your assistance. You must be tired. Please take some rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They look badly injured...

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. They've received proper treatment now. They will recover in time. Thanks to General Jiyan, we've seen a significant drop in the number of casualties.

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've heard from veterans that our soldiers used to be ordinary people, not Resonators. The battles were even brutal back then, with the stench of blood lingering through the rain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But things have improved.

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Each injury represents countless Tacet Discords eliminated by our brave soldiers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Resonators in the Midnight Rangers are incredible warriors. Those who have to retreat from injury must have already taken out hundreds of enemies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They are the ones keeping our people safe. What I've been doing is not worth mentioning compared to them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please don't put it like that. Without your help. we couldn't have helped so many wounded soldiers in such a short time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that they are all safe, you should go and take care of your own issues.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. May I ask where the quartermaster is?

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The quartermaster isn't here. He's on the floor above, directing munitions distribution. Just take that lift and you should find him there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, where are we going next?

Options.PlotLineKey: I want to talk to the quartermaster, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here are some recipes for dietary supplements from my sect. They might help the wounded recover sooner.

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? Great. You have my thanks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the soldiers tended to, you start looking for the quartermaster as advised.

Chapters.Title: Take the elevator to reach the upper level
Take the elevator to reach the upper level
Ask the quartermaster about the situation

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you confirmed the inventory? What about the spare list? Sort out the consumables as soon as possible. Check our communication lines while you're at it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yue, deliver this list to Ase. Oh, you're not Yue. Where is she? What do you need?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excuse me. I'm an Outrider of the Midnight Rangers. This is Rover, and this is Master Jianxin who came here to look for someone.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Tell him about the person Jianxin's looking for.)
Master Jianxin, do you want to go look for Zhiyuan first?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinzhou is the gateway to Huanglong, and the Desorock Highland is the gateway to Jinzhou. A single breach could have dire consequences. Our defense must hold at all costs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tacet Discords are not humans. They don't do truces or ceasefires. For as long as they exist, this war will rage on endlessly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Supply is the lifeblood of our army, and I am tasked with keeping it flowing. But now, we are facing a shortage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I saw you help arrange the wounded there. Xiulan would need your help more than I do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, but I must remain to oversee vital military supplies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jianxin asked the quartermaster about Zhiyuan's whereabouts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhiyuan...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So he never sent a letter home? Not even once?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Midnight Rangers are no longer recruiting non-Resonators lately, but Zhiyuan was a stubborn boy. Last year when the battles hadn't gotten so intense, he would trail us Rearguards, eager to join the frontline.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We sent him back to the city, time and time again, and he just kept finding ways to come back. Eventually I caved and took him in to help us here at the base.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the battle escalating, it's getting increasingly dangerous out here. I shouldn't keep him here any longer. I was just thinking about having the logistics team bring him back to the city when you guys showed up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, now I remember. He should be currently on the floor above.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure. Please excuse me. I'll join you later.

Options.PlotLineKey: We'll be meeting up with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jianxin did a brief salute and left.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What... what are you doing!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... Please excuse me. Thought that was a grenade... Is this... a mangosteen?

Options.PlotLineKey: What do you know about the mangosteen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a type of old-fashioned explosive. The Lament caused a global technological regression and shortage of resources.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While Tacetite Weapons were being developed, most people had limited knowledge of Tacetite as an energy source. As a result, primitive products combining old and new technology emerged.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The hand grenade was one of them. With the rapid growth of Tacetite Weapons, these crude explosives were eventually phased out in favor of more advanced weaponry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... it's not a local fruit, so we can only get it through imports. But, with the recent Tacet Discord outbreaks, we've had to prioritize bringing in the essentials. We'll get back to importing more of these after General Jiyan makes his triumphant return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Currently, there's only one waterway open, from Port Gunchao in the south of the city. The Rearguards would regularly go there to escort goods.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rearguard Battalion Camp Officer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... What more do I know... The military rarely buys this fruit for rations due to its short shelf life. Plus, it looks too much like a grenade, and that could cause some issues.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The quartermaster reveals Zhiyuan's likely whereabouts. Jianxin leaves to continue her search for Zhiyuan. You show the quartermaster the mangosteen, which he mistakes for a grenade. After the misunderstanding is resolved, he tells you about the dire situation in the Norfall Barrens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you also Midnight Rangers? Can you tell me about the battles on the front line?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? I knew it! What about the other soldiers? Have they all come back?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why do I only see a few of you?

Options.PlotLineKey: I came here specifically to find you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you kidding me? How is it possible that there is no movement at all? Aren't you Midnight Rangers?

Options.PlotLineKey: I came here specifically to find you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Ah? What, what did I do! I just secretly sneaked into the army, that's all?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Scary, are you guys hired by my grandpa to bring me back home!?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not because there is no other way. After I arrived in Jinzhou, I inquired around and heard that the front line was in a fierce battle. I thought it was a good opportunity for me to contribute...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have always heard that everyone in Jinzhou is a soldier, and I thought that as long as I was a volunteer, I could go to the front line and contribute. Who knew that the organization of the Midnight Rangers has changed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you're already here, you shouldn't just come for nothing, right? This is where my grandfather served when he was young. It would be nice to take a look, even if just for a moment! As for joining the army, let's think of a way. There are always more solutions than difficulties!

Options.PlotLineKey: You really came here for a vacation, huh?
I just heard them say they will take you to a military court.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, I will continue to work hard!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, now is not the time to encourage him!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course not... not entirely... I made up my mind to reach Jinzhou, but I didn't expect the journey to be so difficult...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, this monument was erected by my grandfather here back then. I never thought I would be able to see it after so many years. It's like a dream come true...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it true? No, please don't! My grandfather's glorious achievements will be tarnished because of me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, don't scare him...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhiyuan, just like you, your grandfather came to Jinzhou alone from your hometown to find your whereabouts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What?! My grandfather is in Jinzhou now? Is he okay? Is he injured? Does my family know?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This old man, he can't take care of himself no matter what. My mom must be so worried!

Options.PlotLineKey: ...You and your grandfather really look alike.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, Grandpa Zhiyuan is safe. I came down from the mountain and accompanied him all the way to Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grandpa is now in the Patrol Station in Jinzhou, and he is being taken care of.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you so much for your help. I really appreciate it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm really sorry for the trouble. I'm so useless, I made a mess of things... I'm sorry, I just want to be alone for a while...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, I'm afraid I won't be able to escort Zhiyuan back to the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to stay.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is it because of Mister Zongye and Zhiyuan?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is part of the reason.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Actually, up to now, we have found Zhiyuan and seen that he is safe and sound, which is a good result that Mister Zongye has been concerned about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On this journey, I have seen a world different from before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The unity of the people of Jinzhou, the remembrance and longing on the square, the reliability of the Tian Gong defense, the strictness and responsibility of the officers, the destitution and wrong path of the wanderers...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the busyness here, and the beliefs and courage of the people that Zhiyuan has shown me, whether in the past or now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I haven't seen what the battlefield is like, but I seem to have some understanding of war.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At this moment, the front not far away should be much more difficult and intense than what we have seen along the way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Countless lives have been lost in this war...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Master Rongfu once told me, "The best sages gain enlightenment in the military, the mediocre sages gain enlightenment in the bustling cities, and the worst sages gain enlightenment in seclusion."

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I used to practice in the city, helping the poor, helping the weak, and punishing the evil, all with my own strength, helping with the small things I saw in life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This journey has made me start to understand the meaning of the first sentence in Master's words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, I want to stay. This is what I want to do for Jinzhou now, and it is also an opportunity for me to continue to pursue and gain insight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't have to worry about me anymore, I have made up my mind!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have decided to return to Jinzhou City and contribute to the war there!

Options.PlotLineKey: Why did you suddenly have a change of heart?
You're not tricking me, are you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, actually, the words of Master Jianxin inspired me. The things she used to help others with, I think I can do them too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's true! These are all my heartfelt words!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The words of Master Jianxin inspired me. The things she used to help others with, I think I can do them too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And coming here, I have also seen the true face of the front line.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't compare to the Resonators, and continuing to stay here might indeed be a burden, but after returning to the city, there are many things I can do!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So why shouldn't I go back to a place that suits me better? That way, I might be able to help more people, just like Master Jianxin, and also gain more recognition.

Options.PlotLineKey: It seems you have really come to your senses.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That goes without saying, don't underestimate me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for you, don't worry about me anymore. I feel bad enough for making you go through all this trouble.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll wait here. If the rear troops return to the city, I'll go back with them. I won't cause any more trouble for the people here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After I go back, I'll take care of Grandpa first, and then I'll go help. You can rest assured.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems we all have made new decisions.

Options.PlotLineKey: But I can't stay here for too long.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand. Since that's the case, why don't we part ways here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhiyuan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Goodbye, Rover.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have a safe journey and hope to see you again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Us running into Master Jianxin was a one-off incident. If the mangosteen indicates something about war, what is Madam Magistrate trying to convey?

Options.PlotLineKey: That civilizations are born from war and suffer from war.
Perhaps she wants me to meet someone.
Perhaps the moment hasn't arrived yet.
She's just giving me a chance to do a certain thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you thought of something, Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Madam Magistrate wants to tell us about the TD outbreak?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If those Tacet Discords break through our defenses, it would be a disaster for not just Huanglong, but for all of humanity...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Madam Magistrate wants to tell us something about the mangosteen's route of transportation?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That quartermaster said the mangosteens are transported by boat from the South.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Madam Magistrate wants to tell us about General Jiyan, or about the war against Tacet Discords?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We haven't reached the frontlines yet, but I can already smell the iron in the air... I sense tension and unease. Our soldiers stationed at the borders... I hope they are okay...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Food...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You now know the mangosteen has something to do with the war. But in what way? What is Jinhsi trying to tell you? As you ponder these questions, vivid images flood your mind.

Chapters.Title: Ask Jianxin about how it went for her

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Master Jianxin, have you found the person you're looking for?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I've found Zhiyuan. We will return to the city with the logistics team. We will go find Mr. Zongye to let him know he is safe.

Options.PlotLineKey: I heard Zhiyuan didn't want to leave?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhiyuan is a man full of courage. Influenced by his veteran grandpa's tales, he longs to join the military and aid in humanity's battle against Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The journey with you has exposed me to immense suffering, but the battles on the frontline must be even more brutal than what I've witnessed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Countless lives have been lost in this war...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Master Rongfu once told me, "The best sages gain enlightenment in the military, the mediocre sages gain enlightenment in the bustling cities, and the worst sages gain enlightenment in seclusion."

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do share some of Zhiyuan's feelings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, Zhiyuan disagreed with the intense training and tests required to join the military. He saw no distinction between ordinary people and Resonators, and believed he could contribute on the battlefield, however small that contribution might be.

Options.PlotLineKey: Everyone has a part to play.
He's only causing trouble by staying on the battlefield.
He can contribute better without fighting on the frontlines.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I, too, found what Zhiyuan said was reasonable to an extent, and I couldn't change his mind with words. So I tried to imagine what my masters would do. They'd set up a spar in this case. And if I won, they'd let me do what I wanted.

Options.PlotLineKey: Anything that works for you, I guess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't mean to beat him up for nothing. My masters taught me valuable lessons through sparring, and I gained important insights from those fights. Now, who do you think won that fight?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The shape changes, but not the forms; the more it moves, the more it yields. Less thinking, more knowing. Simplify for clarity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I pretended to lose, but Zhiyuan saw it through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After our fight, Zhiyuan admitted he saw the gap between Resonators and ordinary people. He seemed to realize how he was still far from being able to fight the Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He realized how he was just trying to convince himself that he could make a difference, not wanting to acknowledge his own limitations. Fighting on the battlefield requires physical and mental strength, and he was not yet prepared for that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "All tangles untied, all glare tempered, all dust smoothed. It is like a deep pool that never dries.  How true! I've come to understand this line more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I promised not to use my Forte in the battle, but Zhiyuan still couldn't take a single blow from me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After his defeat, Zhiyuan seemed to realize his weakness. Talking about confronting the Tacet Discords on the battlefield would be mere lip service, he said. He was just trying to convince himself that he could make a difference, not wanting to acknowledge his own limitations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard you two still have other matters to attend to. When you have the time, let's catch up at Liuxian Teahouse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's my great pleasure to have met you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Reuniting with Jianxin, you learn she has successfully found Zhiyuan and convinced him to return to Jinzhou. This journey has been enlightening for her, and she looks forward to seeing you and Yangyang again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Us running into Master Jianxin was a one-off incident. If the mangosteen indicates something about war, what is Madam Magistrate trying to convey?

Options.PlotLineKey: That civilizations are born from war and suffer from war.
Perhaps she wants me to meet someone.
Perhaps the moment hasn't arrived yet.
She's just giving me a chance to do a certain thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you thought of something, Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Madam Magistrate wants to tell us about the TD outbreak?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If those Tacet Discords break through our defenses, it would be a disaster for not just Huanglong, but for all of humanity...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Madam Magistrate wants to tell us something about the mangosteen's route of transportation?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That quartermaster said the mangosteens are transported by boat from the South.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Madam Magistrate wants to tell us about General Jiyan, or about the war against Tacet Discords?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We haven't reached the frontlines yet, but I can already smell the iron in the air... I sense tension and unease. Our soldiers stationed at the borders... I hope they are okay...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You now know the mangosteen has something to do with the war. But in what way? What is Jinhsi trying to tell you? As you ponder these questions, vivid images flood your mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to Baizhi, the leaf showed residual fluctuations of Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those fluctuations pointed to a certain set of coordinates.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And that is... Qichi Village, in the Central Plains.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Inspired by Yangyang's words, you close your eyes and tap into your intuition, pinpointing the last token's location: Qichi Village in the Central Plains.

Chapters.Title: Stand your ground. Defeat all Tacet Discords
Stand your ground. Defeat all Tacet Discords
Stand your ground. Defeat all Tacet Discords
Stand your ground. Defeat all Tacet Discords

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the matter? Are you alright?

Options.PlotLineKey: I may have resonated with a Tacet Discord.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was worried... You just stood there and gazed into the distance. You were unresponsive when I tried talking to you. What did you see?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It felt as if I was seeing through the eyes of a Tacet Discord. I think... I saw what was happening in the Norfall Barrens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An imposing warrior wielding the power of a <ano=teal dragon>Qingloong</ano>...  The Qingloong is the Midnight Rangers' emblem. It's also the symbol of General Jiyan, the leader of all Midnight Rangers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The front lines are not far from here. General Jiyan must be there, fighting alongside our soldiers to keep the Tacet Discords away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It doesn't seem like a coincidence. We arrived near the battlefield right when General Jiyan was leading an attack against the Tacet Discords...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A woman in red who can control the Tacet Discords...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could it be... One of the Fractsidus...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your vision... It might be what was happening on the battlefield not far away...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The battle itself is a clear sign of an anomaly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Streams from the Norfall Barrens feel more suffocating than ever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover... something on that battlefield must be connected to you, though we have no idea what it is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Resonate with Tacet Discords...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I didn't hear anything... or sense any frequencies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You recount the visions to Yangyang. She can't explain it but senses a connection between you and something on that battlefield.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to Baizhi, the leaf showed residual fluctuations of Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those fluctuations pointed to a certain set of coordinates.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And that is... Qichi Village, in the Central Plains.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Inspired by Yangyang's words, you close your eyes and tap into your intuition, pinpointing the last token's location: Qichi Village in the Central Plains.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As I make myself reflect on my goals and plans, those voices in the Streams become clearer and everything starts to make more sense.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, perhaps you can give it a try?
